Good girl Logo, you figured it out.

The bear drew closer and smelled the stranger. It didn't know why or 
how it had the same scent but it knew the twin wasn't appearing 
threatening. It's twin was a bit larger than her but it wasn't 
fealing threatened. It nuzzled against Ice smelling the bandages on 
her back. It stepped back slightly, then moved back again. The female 
bear sensed an oddity about it's twin, something that didn't belong. 
It was getting fearful and a bit nervous.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Ice::
> 
> She saw the polar bear approah her. She wasn't sure what to do. She 
> looked and saw that the bear wasn't attacking. She sniffed the 
scent 
> of the bear as it got closer.  It smelled familiar. She couldn't 
pin 
> point it, but she had smelled that bear scent before. She looked at 
> the polar bear. Then it hit her. THIS BEAR WAS HER DNA DONOR!. She 
> smiled. The bear might take her for a sibling if she smelled like 
> this polar bear that was appraching her. She took a few steps 
towards 
> it and lowered head as a sign of submissiveness. 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > OK Logo lets throw in a little suspense into this game.
> > 
> > A scent filled the air for a Polar bear. She knew something was 
> nearby. She
> > went over the hill and saw another bear. The scent was familiar, 
but
> > different. AS if it were a family member. It started downhill 
> through the
> > snow toward it's mirror image. It could sense that it's twin was 
in 
> pain and
> > it's curiosity filled it's instincts.
